titleStmt.title: Jack Moore et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5866

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Thos E Bramlette
Govenor of Ky

Your undersigned petition says. that he was fined $20 -- & cost at the august Term of the Rockcastle circuit court 1864 for Retailing arden spirits without being sworn as requird by a late act of the general assembly He states he was entirely ignorant of the existance of such a law & if he had of new such a law was in existance at the time he would have taken said oath & not have violated the law wherefore he prays. a remission of his said fine
Sworn to before me by Jack Morre October 14th 1864
A Smith cl R c c
We believe the afsd fine aught to be remitted Affiant is a sober & a law abiding young man and would not violate law knowingly we hope the fine will be remitted --

E F Fish
A Smith C. R c c
W A Brooks

Rockcastle Cir Ct
vs
Jack Moore
Remitted
18th Oct/64
